definition: to shave one's head/fig. to become a monk or nun/to take the tonsure
to pare/to reduce/to remove/Taiwan pr. [xue4]
to peel with a knife/to pare/to cut (a ball at tennis etc)
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]

sentences.english: He had thick black hair and hadn't shaved for a day or two.
sentences.chinese: 他厚厚的黑頭髮，並沒有削髮爲一或兩天。

sentences.english: Pour DRAMBUIE over shaved ice in a rocks glass.
sentences.chinese: 傾訴drambuie超過削髮冰在一個岩石的玻璃。

sentences.english: I like to have my downstairs shaved and bare.
sentences.chinese: 我想，我在樓下削髮和裸。

sentences.english: Lenient to who says he doesn t help, tonsure at myself tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 嶽靈珊說自己誰也不幫，明天自己便削髮爲尼。

sentences.english: Please come to eat and sleep with me, or I will cut my hair to be a monk.
sentences.chinese: 請嫁窗胭吧，否則我將削髮爲僧，找個廟來了此一生。

sentences.english: Please come to eat and sleep with me, or I will cut my hair to be a monk
sentences.chinese: 請嫁給我吧，否則我將削髮爲僧，找個廟來了此一生。

sentences.english: Some people entering religious groups have to shave their hair off as proof of their sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 有些人加入宗教組織必須削髮，以示心誠。

sentences.english: The truth is, you don't need to shave your head, or sit with crossed legs to meditate.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，你不必削髮盤坐，像出家人似的冥想。

definition: Emperor Ming of Han (28-75), Western Han Dynasty Emperor 58-75
White Lotus society
to employ/to send for sb promising employment
to ascend the throne
to die of old age/to live to a ripe old age/(fig.) (of sth) to come to an end (after a long period of service)
Zanhuang county in Shijiazhuang 石家莊|石家庄[Shi2 jia1 zhuang1], Hebei
the Dalai Lama/abbr. of 達賴喇嘛|达赖喇嘛[Da2 lai4 La3 ma5]
to open a law court/to set up a mourning hall
imperial edict
variant of 授予[shou4 yu3]
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
Tiandihui (Chinese fraternal organization)
posthumous edict (of former emperor)
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
district magistrate/county magistrate
to prepare for a funeral
